Class ServerControl

java.lang.Object
ServerControl
public class ServerControl
extends java.lang.Object
Class for controlling logging information and controlling shell on windows. Which are used by the continuous integration server to clone and build repository

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ServerControl()

    Gives the shell and run & close command for the current operating system.

  • Method Details

    • runCommand

      public static java.lang.String[] runCommand​(java.lang.String directory, java.lang.String... commandString) throws java.io.IOException
      Runs a specified command on a given shell in a given working directory. E.g. "Cmd.exe", /c, cd, test, with working directory "C:/users" would change directory to test from the directory C:/user if such a directory exist. If such a directory exist the method returns an array with exit code 0 and no error messages, else it returns a array with an exit code not zero and an error messages.
      Parameters:
      directory - string - specifying desired working directory
      commandString - strings - specifying the commands to be executed in order
      Returns:
      String array - with the commands exit code and error messages if any
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - if an I/O error occurs

    • logDataToFile

      public static void logDataToFile​(java.lang.String[] logData) throws java.io.IOException
      Generates a log file in src/main with name ServerLog.txt if non exists and appends the log data to the file. If file exist appends the log data to the file.
      Parameters:
      logData - String array - first entry exit code and second entry error messages if any
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - if logfile exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason

    • getOsShell

      public static java.lang.String[] getOsShell()
      Gives the shell and run & close command for the current operating system. Only checking for operating systems Linux and Windows; if not windows assumes that it is Linux.
      Returns:
      String array - with the shell for the current os and the run and close setting

    • cloneAndBuildMac

      public static java.lang.String[] cloneAndBuildMac​(java.lang.String json) throws java.io.IOException
      Mac server script for cloning and building a repository from github. IN TESTING PHASE USE AT OWN RISK!!!
      Parameters:
      json - String - with Json information
      Returns:
      String array - with information whether the different script steps passed or not
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - if I/O error

    • cloneAndBuildWin

      public static java.lang.String[] cloneAndBuildWin​(java.lang.String json, java.lang.String pushOrPull) throws java.io.IOException
      Windows server script for cloning and building a repository from github
      Parameters:
      json - String - with Json information
      Returns:
      String array - with information whether the different script steps passed or not
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - if I/O error
